title: Stale ArgoCD apps block new lab deployments
description:
When clusters are deleted via 'kind delete cluster', the ArgoCD apps remain in hub cluster and claim shared resources (ClusterRoles, ClusterRoleBindings, Namespaces). This causes new lab deployments to fail with 'is part of applications X and Y' errors. 

Stale apps found: loki-tutorial-target, slo-tutorial-target, observability-cost-tutorial-target

Workaround: Manually delete stale ArgoCD apps before running new labs.

Root cause: kind:down task doesn't clean up ArgoCD apps when deleting clusters.

title: Duplicate cluster secrets cause ArgoCD sync failures
description:
Two different secret naming patterns are used:
- kind:up creates 'argocd-cluster-{cluster}' (line ~504)
- kind:conduct creates 'cluster-{cluster}' (line ~794)
- kind:down only deletes 'cluster-{cluster}'

This leaves orphaned 'argocd-cluster-*' secrets that cause 'there are 2 clusters with the same name' errors.

Fix: Standardize on one naming pattern and clean up both in down task.

title: ArgoCD app stuck in terminating state after cluster deletion
description:
When tearing down experiments, we delete the ArgoCD app with --wait=false then immediately delete the Kind cluster. But the app has a resources-finalizer that requires ArgoCD to clean up resources on the target cluster. Since the cluster is already deleted, the finalizer can never complete and the app is stuck forever in Terminating state.

Observed: deletionTimestamp set but app not deleted due to finalizer.

Impact: Subsequent deploys see 'resource is currently being deleted' warning and may not work correctly.

Fix options:
1. Wait for app deletion before cluster deletion (slow)
2. Remove finalizer before deleting app when cluster is being destroyed
3. Use cascade=orphan to skip resource cleanup
